channel.title: QEMU wiki page
channel.description:
Please check: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/QEMU
Having full dedicated instructions for QEMU is probably overkill, because they match instructions for KVM for the most part.
So if someone specifically asks about QEMU, I plan on just sharing that link. It should explain "follow KVM instructions except for where you import QEMU libvirt files". This seems better than linking to the KVM page.

item.title: QEMU wiki page
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Having full dedicated instructions for QEMU is probably overkill, because they match instructions for KVM for the most part.

True. Just read the page and its nice, straightforward and to-the-point.

Read full topic

item.title: QEMU wiki page
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Please check:

Whonix – 31 Dec 19

QEMU - Whonix

Using Whonix ™ with QEMU instead of VirtualBox

Having full dedicated instructions for QEMU is probably overkill, because they match instructions for KVM for the most part.

So if someone specifically asks about QEMU, I plan on just sharing that link. It should explain “follow KVM instructions except for where you import QEMU libvirt files”. This seems better than linking to the KVM page.

Read full topic
